intro: Lasiandra macrochiton, commonly known as the broad-leaved lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, serrated margin and produces small, clustered flowers in white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
